dialogue: ...I told my parents it was a sleepover.
Did you like it? The show I mean?
Oh yeah. It was... really interesting.
Isabel's a scaredy-cat. She's kind of the main character, but she's also kind of a drip.
Tara's my favorite. She's super hot, and she doesn't take shit from anybody. Plus - she's an expert on demonology.
Oh... Right.
He's always messing with time and reality. He wants to rule the world, to trap Isabel and Tara in The Midnight Realm. So each week he sends a new supernatural foe their way.

When I think about that stuff, it feels like someone took a shovel and dug out all my insides. And I know there's nothing in there, but I'm too nervous to open myself up and check. I know there's something wrong with me. My parents see it too, even if they don't want to say anything...
Do you ever feel like that?
I don't know...
Maybe you're like Isabel...
Afraid of what's inside you.
What?
I'll die if I stay here... I don't know how exactly, but I know that it's true.
...I won't have anyone to watch The Pink Opaque with if you leave.
Hey.
Sit up.
Ma'am? Are you...
Do you need help?
Do you remember me?
...Maddy?
Jesus, Maddy. Where... where have you been?
I know a place on the edge of town.
It'll be safe for us to talk there.
I don't know. Sometime.
Pack as much as you can in your overnight bag next Saturday. You can't tell anyone we're leaving. Not your mom. Not anyone.
Where will we go?
We'll know where when we get there.
The Drain Lord. Like the Drain Lords...
It's not real if I don't think about it. It's not real if I don't think about it.
Isabel...
